channel.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Worldwide][Dedicated Servers] - APIv6 BringYourOwnImage routes operation
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 09:30 - 09:45 UTC

Feb 14, 00:54 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 19/03/2024 09:30 UTC
End time : 19/03/2024 09:45 UTC
Service impact : Some API calls definitely removed.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, this maintenance will enables customers to deploy cloudready images directly on their dedicated server.

The following API calls will be definitely removed:

GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

DELETE /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

Customers can still use the Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) feature from the API call POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/start. More details can be found in the documentation page.
This change was required in order to add the new Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux) feature.
Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) / Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux), a comparison sheet - OVHcloud.

item.title: [Worldwide][Dedicated Servers] - IPXE scripts migration
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 5, 09:00 - 09:45 UTC

Feb 6, 23:27 UTC
Scheduled - Start time :05/03/2024 09:00 UTC
End time : 05/03/2024 09:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy about IPXE (open-source implementation of the Preboot eXecution Environment), the following API calls will be definitely removed:
POST /me/ipxeScript
PUT /me/ipxeScript/{name}
Customers can still use that feature by using the "bootScript" key within the PUT /dedicated/server/{serviceName} API call: see documentation for more details.

item.title: [Worldwide][Dedicated Servers] - Netboot rescue-customer operation
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 20, 13:00 - 13:15 UTC

Feb 14, 01:17 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 20/02/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 20/02/2024 13:15 UTC
Service impact : bootId key value set to 46984 will need to change for servers in CA region.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, we will be removing duplicate Netboot rescue-customer.

Customers directly using API call PUT /dedicated/server/{serviceName} on a dedicated server located in CA region (any dedicated server with service name ending with .net) to switch boot mode to Linux rescue type with bootId key value set to 46984 will need to change to value 46371.
Customers taking this bootId value dynamically from API call GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/boot?bootType=rescue are not impacted.
Customers using API call PUT dedicated/server/{serviceName} with a bootid value other than 46984 are not impacted.
For any dedicated server located in EU or US regions: no impact.

item.title: [ERI1][DedicatedServers] - E102H08
item.description:
Feb 18, 02:41 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 18/02/2024 01:30 UTC
End time : 18/02/2024 02:35 UTC
Service impact : Services are working as they should be.
Root cause : It was due to a malfunction on a power supply

Feb 18, 01:48 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Feb 18, 01:47 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 18/02/2024 01:30 UTC
Service impact : Some servers are unreachable in this rack
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [RBX2][Dedicated Servers] - Rack 24A11
item.description:
Feb 17, 13:54 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 17/02/2024 12:32 UTC
End time : 17/02/2024 13:45 UTC
Root cause : electrical malfunction
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Feb 17, 13:22 UTC
Update - Our technical teams solved the electrical problem.
The electrical problem affected a network equipment located in the rack.
Our teams are in the process of replacing the affected equipment so that the servers can be reached.

Feb 17, 12:56 UTC
Identified - Start time : 17/02/2024 12:32 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rack 24A11 are temporarily unavailable.
Root cause : An electrical issue caused the problem
Ongoing actions : Our teams are currently working to solve the issue.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
